meta.description: Disallow null comparisons without type-checking operators

content.introduction:
Disallownullcomparisons without type-checking operators
Table of ContentsRule DetailsWhen Not To Use ItCompatibilityRelated RulesVersionResources
Comparing tonullwithout a type-checking operator (==or!=), can have unintended results as the comparison will evaluate totruewhen comparing to not just anull, but also anundefinedvalue.
if(foo==null){bar();}123Copy code to clipboard
